g7Hf-JeJ78kTbEMVHSs0Mw.text: Hey, wait a second. Since when are pizza parlors this cool? Not only are they a sit down restaurant and delivery spot during the day, they turn into a dive bar at night. Can't say I've seen much of that! And the beers are as cheap as they get. $2 pints of Killian's Red? So awesome that my liver just flinched.  The pizza is just alright. Sweet sauces can be awesome, but only if you have the right crust and cheese to balance that out. On top of that, I know a meaty pizza can get greasy, but Pullano's is excessively so. In hindsight, the $13 for the 16" really wasn't worth it, but maybe if you wait for some of the specials they have on Wednesday, you can sample a cheaper one for yourself. The menu is VERY expansive, too, which tells me you're pretty much gonna get more of the same as far as quality.  3 as a pizza place, but a solid 5 as a dive.

Pd1UNyVflGKhQucf-IyDQg.text: Came here for their Wednesday night special, $5.99 for a large cheese pizza. Got here around 8 & were seated right away, they have plenty of TV's for watching the game.  Service was pretty slow but we weren't in a hurry. The pizza was GREAT! More like a pan pizza (thicker crust).  We had half leftover so we had dinner & lunch the next day for $6! Awesome! Their menu was huge & I noticed they had quite a few other weekly specials. Will be back next Wednesday :)

B_6IvK_bUEg4K_1xFssYgg.text: This place is great! They have the best wings and I love that the veggies are extra fresh. As a kid my best friend her parents (a wonderful Italian Family) used to come here a lot and used to get to go orders. Their pizza is amazing now as a mother and wife I take my husband pizza and wings from here all the time.  The family owned restaurant is awesome they definantly appreciate the men and women in the service!  GREAT JOB PULLANO'S!

4MGY5S5yt5zKql3RdFWKng.text: Every time it's fantastic. I really enjoy when we get there pizza and wings. Pizza crust is always perfect. Love the Italian large pizza buy a large get a medium free. You cant go wrong. Garlic bread is great too

EHwB244aE0_1drUDH-rZAw.text: We have been coming here for years. The menu is very vast. The service is great. My husband loves the lasagna my daughter and I like the bruschetta. I also think they have some of the best wings I've had. I like the mild jerk wings

z6fF7b9pzjUE7HKn0t_Qdg.text: Pullanos is a iconic landmark when it comes to pizza and wings on the west side! I've been coming here for years and always am pleased! They have since added a bar on one side, which has a nice neighborhood feel to it, and has tons of tvs to enjoy the games. Plus everything including drinks is very reasonably priced. Pullanos now has it all! Why go to some bar and pay a ton for overpriced bar food when you can come to Pullanos and get the best pizza and wings in phx!

9CKIeCY-eok2BhCgvhn_NA.text: We returned to Pullano's for our usual order. The service was friendly, attentive, and prompt. The food was delicious, as always! We're so glad that our one not-so-great experience hasn't become the norm at Pullano's. We'll definitely be continuing customers!

r1MloyIJnGrb-2dYx0aK4A.text: Pullanos is my absolute favorite place for pizza and wings. I take all of my family here and recommend this place to everyone. The wings are amazing, the pizza is huge and delicious. My favorite thing though is the Wisconsin cheese curds! Being from Wisconsin I give these 5 stars it tastes like home. Great environment and the staff is always friendly.

I-7bUPCJKB7tY1sEoRSzYA.text: I'm fairly new to Arizona and would never have known about Pullano's if not for an ASU classmate. I've now been there several times with friends, and all in all, I love the place. It's perfect for unwinding after work or school. The drinks are strong and fairly priced and the food is pretty decent too. One tip though, don't try ordering any fancy drinks. This is not the place to order a mojito or an old fashioned. Stick to the basics and you won't be disappointed!   I think the best part about Pullano's is the service. The girls who work in the bar area are nothing short of awesome. They're friendly and attentive and never leave you wondering where your server went.   Also, the restaurant is divided into two parts: a dining room area and a bar area, so whether you're looking for a family dinner or a boozy night out with friends, Pullano's has what you need. Definitely a must-try if you're in the area!

usQkE1Cj6KBYAIr-rpRqHA.text: Coming from NYC it's been a struggle to find a reasonably priced Italian meal  that's decent and edible without going broke. I live in this area and find the food at Pullano's to be very good tasting and the portion size is a good value. The wings here are also top notch and for a local joint  ya can't beat it.

yDDClGuJi3Lgya7ykZ1_uw.text: The best pizza and wings ! And the lasagna? Best ever!  My Italian mother claims it's the most authentic she has tasted. Come hungry. The service is wonderful and friendly. Makes me feel like I'm coming to their home instead of their restaurant. Thanks for the high standards of service and food.  A must try!

3xB8DiVX3AoV2N5Vz6A85A.text: Ok  been here 3-4 times and finally taking the time to write a short review.  This is a great spot for wings, pizza, salad and subs!!  So far  my top in the Phoenix area  everything I have had.... I have loved.  Im sold it is not to close to my house but Iam convinced I need to drive to get great pizza, lots of flavor and it heats up fantastic the next day (the cheap pizza sometimes is good but doesnt taste like anything the next day!)   the winds are great  and if you like heat  they got it.   the italian sub is great toasted cant wait to go back again for lunch  $7.99 1/2 a sub and salad  great dressing salads are fantastic.  Im sure their pastas are just as good will be there soon to try them out......Customer Service is top notch   servers and very attentive to your needs and freely let you know if a special is a better deal for you.  great place you will love it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pullano's Pizza & Wings - Glendale, AZ, United States. Lunch special- Italian Sub, (sherry&#39;s favorite/spicy) 1/2 sub and a salad. $7.99

Rvlo865jJeXu9SvpYD9Hjw.text: My first time here and let me tell you- it was delicious! my boyfriend and i sat in the bar and watched the yotes game. We ordered 2 beers, nice selection of drafts, and pizza & wings. it was the best pizza & wings i've had in a long time. the pepperoni and jalepeno pizza was so cheesy & spicy- all you need in life, and the hot wings & hot jerk wings were crispy and delicious! service was great, very attentive & quick! will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pullano's Pizza & Wings - Glendale, AZ, United States. pepperoni &amp; jalepeño pizza with a hot wing! yum!

3cr8miv52w4It9EkPyDiVg.text: This message is to Mike.  Just wanted to say, I brought my grandma here the other night, and she got mad at me for not showing her this place years ago. She has a real Italian food tooth, and she fell in love with food, and the place. I like how it doesn't look a day out of the late 80's. Just like another, old and memorable submarine sandwhich shop on 35th Ave and Peoria. All these people saying your food is terrible make me laugh. 36 years is hard to come by. Thanks for serving that real food up!

-cI1w0m_WO6JvT0rLBSSRg.text: Been going to this place for 25 years, my girls are great (service) and the pizza & wings are the best!!

Jv9ka4tMXD69xj9jOAt_Yg.text: pullano's for lunch I always love to order pizza from this place never been disappointed. However there lunch sandwiches are pretty pricey. I must say use extreme caution they boast about how amazing everything is and I ate the worst cheese steak sandwich in my entire life! I'm not kidding I got a sample of a microwavable cheese steak sandwich at Costco and it blows pullano's cheese steak out of the water you're better off going and buying a roll from the deli department and getting the frozen box of steakums and make it yourself. Will never return again except to pick up pizza to take home! Pullanos you better check yourself before you wreck yourself. This was my third time coming back for your lunch specials and trying something different and again disappointed you make wonderful pizza everything else throw in the garbage.

rK5tR_mRBRHgUv6xFDeGfA.text: Absolutely amazing antipasto salad!!! Pizza and wings fabulous!! Michelob ultra on tap, need i say more!! Gets a little crowded but worth it!!

l50A9GR4t49-wsty6NK71Q.text: Ive been coming to this place since I was a kid, and I swear it gets better each visit. We always get the kyles, and wings and they are gone within a matter of moments. The pizza is always hot and fresh and made with the best ingredients.the staff has always been amazing and sweet, and so helpful! Plus my husband and I love watching the game and grabbing a beer. we will always be a customer here!!!!!!!!!!

AjlFFBgq5CX3wDHSvUWLvA.text: Visiting the Glendale area, I wasn't sure what to expect.  But this had the best reviews out of the Sports Bars in the area, so it got our business, and did not disappoint. The service was excellent, as were the pizzas and beer. One thing I thought was very cool is that one area is the "restaurant side," and the opposite area is the "sports bar" side, so no matter what kind of evening you're looking for, it seems like Pullano's is a great place to try out.

9_iY0evkmfKhYbdtMNY64Q.text: The best pizza on the west side... 51st Ave and T-bird.  It's a Mom and Pop shop that I've grown up with... moved away, and happened to go back recently so I can review it. :)  They are still the same as always... the same red and white checkered table covers, the placemats of Italy...   And the friggen awesome wings and pizza.  Holy crap I had forgotten how good they were... and they are now offering other flavors of wings, like Garlic and Parmesan... altho the medium flavor does fine with me. :)  The pizza... it's floppy... it's greasy... the stuff falls off, but you can't help but just want to eat more.  ESPECIALLY when you get down to the crust. Their crust is AWESOME.  Another couple of cool things... they have1.50 coors lite during races, .99 beers during happy hour, and for those of us who are used to very expensive beers... their normal price is 2.75 for beers.  Bar that is attached has all day every day $2 drafts.   Service: in the beginning it was iffy... there was no smiling from this chick.  But she seemed to relax with us as the food was delivered and things went well.  So... if you want a local place to check out some wings, pizza and beer... go here.

HJUKKxH5uCZIqNmnm3os0Q.text: Definitely the best place for pizza and wings I have ever had . The one in Glendale, Arizona is amazing, the wings are always crispy and fresh, the pizza is amazing, the pollukee is heavenly, there fries are so good especially when you dip it in the wing sauce. Not to mention,but their ranch is so good. Since I have a family of five , they have a good deal for a extra large pizza,  and forty wings for $35. My daughter and I are the foodies of my family, and we have a very expensive taste , we aren't picky we just know what foods are good and Pullano's  is is one of our favorites. Good job Pullano's , you passed the foodie test .

uso8zj-u3JR7WSV5we7j9g.text: Where do I start, four star average for this dump, I think not. old and dirty is my impression of this restaurant and the pizza was terrible and undercooked to the point of soggy raw dough in the middle and no flavor, it been 10 year's since iv tried this place and now I remember why, they did gain 1 star for the wings being cooked right and way better than the pizza, that said we will never be back, what a waste of $23

5bp1y90EcYODDME0XwyZoA.text: Best Pizza and Wings in the valley hands down!! There is best of both worlds with having a split format.. if your looking for good time, hanging out watching games the bar is great for that. If your there for family time or a date, the dinning room is a great choice.. overall love this place!

_adj0QoW3y_2sdWSGFN7bg.text: First time and it was good. Our waitress was attentive and the food was great.  Definitely would come back.

uO1_B_uetuO8GcekGVc-jw.text: by far a very family oriented Buffalo Bills Bar  We have been there a few times. The Super Bowl Party was fantastic and truly made the Day    Great wings.  Pizza.  Chili.  I cannot thank them enough for making this Day Magical.    Thank You for the Great Thyme

BfJwnGyyP4aH-KWgOsGJkg.text: We went for our first visit , today, to watch the Super Bowl!  We had a blast! Everything was well organized, the food was awesome, and the staff amazing.  Thank you for a great experience, Pullano's,   We will be back!

dkb8n891qVVT__9fjqDhXQ.text: I literally come here almost every Wednesday with my girls. I love their wings, pizza, Or any of the appetizers. As being a foodie and a pizza enthusiast, I love this pizza, it is extremely good. The staff is always very friendly, they remember me every time I come in and if I don't bring my girls they asked me where my girls are. A real family oriented place. I will keep coming here for years to come and hope that one day my kids will bring thre kids here. Best pizza in Phoenix in my Opinion.

mIohUN1WD4dVN4H5sPk6lQ.text: We haven't been there in years and were pleasantly surprised to see that the pizza and wings are delicious as always. Personally I suggest the garlic parmesan wings.They are my favorite. Donna Mumaw

PwSiEw0tDwaAdZPTGwA5hQ.text: The best pizza and wings in Arizona. Great specials and tv's everywhere. We drive from Goodyear to eat here. A must place to try and get hooked.

IiwULInBjLmNUHhwTlh1_g.text: We have been eating at Pullano's for years. The food and service are top notch. My wife likes the salads, I love the Stromboli. Definitely worth a try.

BqFDxx1QHsdL04krxk4BpA.text: This Is one of my favorite places to go, not only is it super close to me but it has the best pizza I've had lately. The appetizers are good as well as the wings and the drinks are fantastic. I love going there to watch games.

WV5tEwnzUWG9yZ94oXoThw.text: What a great little hole in the wall. The wings are delicious. I ate wayyyy to many. The pizza is fantastic as well. I couldn't get enough. I wouldn't have seen this place because it is out of the way in the strip mall and not well advertised but it was full of people when we attended.

_0ldLsky99yuLbr_YtLwLQ.text: Eat at or order from Pullanos's regularly. Love the wings and pizza. You can't go wrong eating here! The wait staff is great and they have great eat-in specials.

vprZHtPXle_Rz7m3h726Kg.text: Yep, this place is just OK.  We ordered carry out while visiting the area.  The dude taking the order didn't know the menu.  Yeah I said dude cause he sounded like a dude.  Not sure what that means but it sounds right.  He was pretty oblivious.  We ordered enough to feed a small army and the service was super fast for how much we got.  We ordered hot wings(not hot), spicy honey bbq wings(not spicy) and garlic parm wings(ok).  The fried pickles were overcooked and the pepper jack cheese sticks were good but I was thinking they would be better.  The pizza was nothing to really remember.  The best part was the nice airy crust.  I would probably try this place again since there menu is huge.  I would just try some different entree's and apps.  Unfortunately I wasn't impressed with the pizza or wings but maybe the other food is worth talking about.

ExGfCO5VHx5nwj-OYhdkHg.text: Use to love Pullano's but the quality is really bad. It's never busy and they don't care about the food they provide to their customers. Truly sad.

xckYpXeGXQcFFx1lQNZMQA.text: Pizza, wings, and salads are always amazing! Such a great alternative to chain pizza company's a little on the expensive side. Every time we order from here it's always $60 but the quality is unbeatable so well worth it

UGiV3-FEqAgiViu1MHbYPQ.text: Free pizza in the bar is real good. Front of the house is all ladies and they are absolutely wonderful! On Wednesday, 3-6 there's a free taco bar

Nypu5xb0JPRThNu4lsCDjg.text: My favorite pizza in the valley. If I had to pick up my kids from daycare or get pizza from here, my kids would understand my choice on putting them 2nd. #fact

hYw_mjc_qQMPHhAEB7KU7Q.text: Their pizza is pretty good but love their wings and their pastas! Great casual atmosphere and friendly employees. Great special Tuesday nights for BOGO half off entrees

ByTqi91MHrtEitM8lMkWcQ.text: Best pizza and wings in town!  They have great specials and service is friendly and pretty fast.

H8ji_vFQ0x-5DSJ18m6p_w.text: I am a big fan of this place.  While I haven't been there before 10pm and I don't necessarily go there for dinner, it is a great place for cheap beer and free pizza on the weekends.  Yes I said that right, Friday and Saturday night's from 10p - 12a it's a free pizza buffet and $1.50 drafts (used to be $1, but I'm not complaining).  They bring out 4 pizzas at a time to the buffet area and they get cleaned out pretty quickly, so make sure to take more than 1 slice at a time if you have a hearty appetite.  They're also a little slow at bringing out new pizzas, but if you plan accordingly, you can definitely get stuffed.    I haven't tried any of the other foods, and after reading the other reviews I think I will stick with $1.50 drafts and free pizza.  But the price is right, the beer is cold, and the pizza is good.  Can't go wrong here.

VPvLNPA7b8mY9-6-Sokm4g.text: I have heard some very good things about this place. recently went with my boyfriend and two other friends in...December? November? So the pizza...delicious. The cheese poppers..whatever they are called are the best part, in my opinion. I will return in the future. The cheese popper appetizers are what will make me return to Pullano's. These mom and pop restaurants/retail stores put the chains to a shame. This is one of those mom and pop restaurants.

UjmDRvHouTUmP8UrqNV6qw.text: I love this place so much, I went on Wednesday & I'm going back for lunch today.best wings in the city hands down!!!!

qRTSYt8MpWUmQGamycdaOQ.text: Thank you fellow Yelpers, we love this place.  My husband loves the pizza, I am addicted to their wings....mmm....their wings!

HbxRwiRn3LeJpxsofcohDQ.text: Gag. Gag and a half. Not only was the food pretty gross, the experience itself was ridiculous.   Let me just start by saying that my husband really are very laid back people. We both HATE to complain about food. Neither of us are extremely picky. I promise I am not that person that complains constantly about places.   This place came highly recommended from my boss, who is in love with their food. She talks about it all the time. My husband and I were craving some Italian, and I suggested we go here. The exterior itself looks pretty shady, but sometimes hole in the wall places end up being amazing. Not the case here.    We sit down and review the massive menu. My husband sees that they are doing $0.40 wings. He decides to do that. When the waitress comes to take our order the following stipulations were explained if he wanted to take advantage of the deal  -You can only get 1 flavor. (ok, I guess that is not that big of a deal) -You must order a soda (annoying...but whatever) -You can't leave the restaurant with them. She literally told him "If you don't eat all your wings, we are going to throw them away. You can't take them with you." (Extremely annoying, petty, and wasteful) OK fine. I will get the wings and stick to your stupid rules. And then this happened:  Waitress "Ranch or Blue Cheese?" Husband "Can I try one of each?" Waitress " well, you can only have one per order....I mean I guess I can do that for you, but I have to charge you extra for it"  Seriously? I tried to stifle my laughter, but the entire wing conversation had been so obnoxious, it was laughable. It would be one thing if she was nice and was just trying to follow the rules, she was pretty rude.   OK so my husband gets his order of wings in, after agreeing to the "wing laws". I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Safe choice. Not. My meal came with soup. Meh. Nothing great. The food comes, the wings are decent. I laughed again when I saw the spaghetti.  I am not exaggerating  when I say that it was noodles, on top of tomato soup with microwaved meatballs on top. Yum! My husband looked at my plate with a "wtf" face. We took a picture of it because of what an amazing failure it was. My husband said "The only time I have seen spaghetti like that is when I try to make it at home."    I'm pretty sure the waitress knew that it looked nasty. It was a drop and run. We didn't see her again for 20 minutes. I eventually flagged her down and sent the food back. My husband asked if I would like to share some wings with him. We order another small order of wings. They were again, just ok. I ordered the raspberry chipotle wings, they tasted like bottled BBQ sauce. Nothing amazing. When we finished our food, we waited another 15 minutes for someone to notice us. 3, yes 3 waiters walked right by us. It was obvious that we were done. Their were napkins on both plates and we were just sitting there. One waiter walked by twice.  And we still sat there. Finally our waitress came back took a couple dishes and disappeared again. They must have a freaking amazing break room or something. The best part was when I turned around to see if any employees could come rescue us, and a big group of wait staff are standing in one little spot watching the game. mmmk. cool. We'll just wait til you are done there.     So lets review, bad service, awful food, bad location, wing laws. No thanks. It would be one thing if you had amazing wings, but the wings are just average. They are neither here nor there. I would rather go to Native New Yorker's for wing night. They don't care how many ranches you want. haha  EDIT: After this was posted, I received a viscous, profanity filled response from a stranger who was apparently HUGELY insulted that I didn't like a trashy restaurant that he considers a 5 star establishment. So I share my bad experience on a website that was created to keep others in the know and I get attacked with insults and derogatory comments? So guess what Pullano's, I just dropped a star on my review. You are disgusting and so are your loyal patrons.

pIyER5dgNyTKJ3Wf_t9WSQ.text: Delicious Veal Parmigiana!!! My parents go there all the time and ask for "awesome Austin" for their waiter.  Friendly, fast service, food tasted fresh!! Great family owned place.

y5M6DLmXZQn1JFFQh6B14w.text: Aghh..good ol College days at ASU West..Pullano's really helped with those 3 hour longg classes...I mean..how can you beat free pizza and dollar PBR's? This place is amazing to get a good pre class buzz on..but dont get your hopes up cuz unfortunately the monotonic instructor will eventually kill the buzz

yr0jiZP0BhUk_cYEckPV-g.text: Good old-fashioned American pizza/tavern here, with $2 pints of domestic beers during happy hour when I was there and appetizer specials as well.  I didn't care so much for the "spicy" pasta sauce since it seemed to be marinara with buffalo wing sauce mixed into it.  Pizza was fresh with a pillowy soft crust and good cheese.  Service was prompt, though a bit traditional - I'm glad that there's another pint of beer in front of me without having to order it, but some of us just don't drink the same beer over and over.

4htEyNEY2pl1F2J36RiPMw.text: MMMMMMM.....chicken wings. These are the best wings in town. Pizza is good too. We go for the 30 cent wing ding night on Monday. Split 30 or 40 wings a couple sodas and leave full for less than $15. The happy hour specials in the bar are pretty kick ass too. Can't beat $1 drafts and free pizza. We have turned all of our friends on to Pullano's (including some of the reviewers here).

awMDqWXcqDIRzsSOA3Jkuw.text: Love their wing flavor selection. Miss the 40 cent wing night, but hey, it hasn't kept us away. My fav is hot garlic parmesan. The meatballs are humongous and wonderful. Great servers--ask for Deb.

GS5Nf65wgRTHpODtYgX1Ww.text: Moved from Phoenix ten years ago but still crave a cheese pizza and buffalo wings from this place.

vVrklX3M3gS-rMUAlwzl4w.text: I am originally from pittsburgh and this place has the ambiance and food that reminds me of home.   The pizza is good but I absolutely love the dry jerk cajun wings.   I like their subs too.

ajhc_aayXmI5noajoe0TUA.text: The pizza is good and the wings are above average.   The decor is very cheesy and the space seems to be crammed.  This place has a decent wing deal on Mondays and Thursdays.  30 cents a wing with purchase of drink.  You must be able to eat at least 15-20 wings a person in order for the deal to be worth it.

cNUhEDBwVX1AkvbEjhC8Cg.text: I really like this place a lot. There seems to be a lot of families that go here, larger groups. The waitresses are nice and it's clean inside. I like the HD flat screen tv's. They always seem to have sports on which is what you want at a sports bar. ;) I have not tasted the pizza but i have tried their krab salad, cheese fries, meatball sub, and Italian sub. All of them were fantastic. My boyfriend always gets the philly cheese steak with fries. He says it's decent but still not as good as Philly's Best in Cali. The interior is rather simple and not at all fancy but has a homey appeal to it. Prices are good and you get large portions here. Definitely recommend eating here.

Mjb4wS6yNyYmfa5t9yzlyg.text: I have to say that Pullano's Pizza is one of the best places to get pizza and wings in Glendale. They give you so many toppings to choose from and a huge variety of wings as well. The service and atmosphere is pretty good, and they keep the bar and dining area separated so you can bring the whole family. I highly recommend the place if you are in the area and want to have a few drinks, and eat lots of delicious pizza and wings.

IuaWzMo6Xep2spCeFRILFg.text: Friendly service, good food and nice drink specials.  Free pizza Thursday nights.

_85Cgtoc9k4wWB2gEYltkQ.text: This is definitely a sport's bar. Laid back atmosphere, nice waitstaff. TVs everywhere with all kinds of sports on. I have a buy one get one free dinner coupon from dine4az.com. Waitress was happy about it, didn't get all rude like waitresses usually do when handed a coupon. My boyfriend got spaghetti and meatballs, I had lasagna. The portions were HUGE. You could easily share a dinner with someone. The lasagna was average, not great, not bad. I tried a piece of the meatball, it was very good. I would've rather had that. Meatball was juicy, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Overall good experience. I heard they were known for their pizza and wings, so next time I will be trying that.

-6nCCBnDBftV7aqyvyr16w.text: This place has AMAZING wings!!!  I was never a big wing fan, but this place helped me turn a corner in my love for hot chicken wings.  Both the bone in and bone out are DELISH.  OH WOW.  We live in California and have family in Phoenix.  During every visit this place is at the top of the "to do" list.  The pizza is okay - my husband is an East Coast native so he has shown me real pizza heaven and this is not that.  But the wings.........wow.....yum.

X-dFVzzmx3D9m9h-VhOzTQ.text: Just moved here from SF and this place was the first place I went to for dinner.  I went with my bf because he wanted to try pizza out here and actually found this place on yelp.   We ordered the Pullano's special as well as some wings and we devoured everything.   I absolutely love this place and fell in love with it the very first time which is a rare case for me no matter what the food is or where it is.  The staff there was super nice and our waitress Jessica was especially nice.  She welcomed me to the neighborhood and made me feel at home away from home.  They also have a bar and occasionally give free pizza there as well.  Also they have different specials everyday of the week so go check it out and see what their special is today!

Tk2Z83trybZMb7n-Xyoj6A.text: rhia: food is delicious. service is sometimes lacking. it depends on which waitress and what her mood is. they also forget things that you tell them.  summer: the waitresses apparently all have to be memorizers. maybe the recession made paper hard to afford. they never write down what you order. today we ordered mild wings with honey bbq on the side; we got the opposite.  rhia: they have tasty 30 cent wings on mondays, however the purchase of a drink is stipulated. plus you get charged more than a buck for a side of sauce. for real?  summer: at two bucks for the drink, and three for the ten wing minimum, it's still a decent deal. only your mom is a better bargain.   rhia: fun atmosphere. laid back. and it's always busy, but not so busy that you have to wait long for a table.  summer: they like the buffalo bills and george bush. a lot. as seen plastered all over the walls. which is a fun setting for a table full of lesbians and our friend cindy. also they have italy place mats that are a good save if you're conversation gets that awkward lull in it.  rhia: uh. y-o-u-r.  summer: right right.  rhia: we're becoming monday night regulars for the cheap ass wings. but any other night, i'll pass.  summer: i like to feed the babies the pullookie, delicious pizza-cookie with ice cream, for dinner. (that's not True, i feed them prior to, i'm not that bad of a parent).  we agree: good for wings. we don't really eat the other food. we hear the salads are delectable. happy hour at the bar seems like a good bet also, but we really aren't happy hour sports bar kind of girls. believe it or not.

xRM9Ww8q2A_QR6tlf8rquw.text: I grew up a couple of blocks away from Pullano's, and I still live nearby.  My family is from Buffalo, so Pullano's pizza has been our go-to pizza place my entire life. They used to deliver, but it's still worth driving over for a pick-up.  The Giant slice lunch special is awesome. The wings are fantastic and the pizza is something I craved while I was living abroad.  The owner is usually in the building, and they even provide homemade sweets during the holidays.  There is free pizza in the bar after 10pm, and it's worth it, but it goes fast. It's a small bar and it usually contains a a few rowdy people. but since it's in walking distance of my house, it's a place I love visiting.  I've only ever had a couple of things besides pizza and they were all great - but the pizza and wings are what they are known for.  With football season upon us, make sure you wear your favorite team jersey when you visit, and enjoy!

XSFMTAN4vhtV_h6FigjTJQ.text: Amazing pizza and wings! Great place to watch AZ sports

nij-oSMv61BUFPnB2lqtIg.text: I've driven by this place countless times, but never went in until a friend told me about the 99 cent beers and free pizza on Friday nights (after 10:00).  I was skeptical and was sure there was some sort of catch, but there really wasn't. Well I drive all the way over to pick up my pizza and wings and low and behold I get there and noticed that I forget my coupon so I ask them is it okay if I get my pizza and wings this time without the coupon I live about 5 miles away and didn't want to drive all the way back just to get a coupon so the girl told me NO. I have asked for a manager and a manager had came out and I asked her the same question only to get the same answer so I left without paying for my food which would have been an extra $10 because I had forgotten the coupon the manager knows if these are heavily circulated and could have gave me a pass but chose not to so for that reason I give it one star and I will never return to this place again

dsl7ZEavKhLI4HRKqSknBg.text: The pizza and wings are really tasting. The service was great, but the location and atmosphere left something to be desired.  I would hit up pullanos again, but only for take out.

Kqnf9LejZw3uwRGPW9VGcg.text: Let's call a spade a spade; there's really not that much that separates Pullano's from any of its competition, of which there is plenty. There's a Hungry Howie's down 51st street, a Ballpark Pizza on Thunderbird, Pizza by Napoli in the opposite direction on T-bird, and a Domino's practically across the street.   They all make pizza. They all make hot wings. They will all make your intestines hate you.  What sets Pullano's apart from the others is the atmosphere. Pullano's is a fun place to be. There are giant TVs all over the place, blaring whatever sporting event is going on. The walls are covered with team paraphernalia and the occasionally offensive but amusing show of patriotism (like a picture of an F-16 with a guy on a magic carpet shopped in).  Pullano's is the perfect place to bring large groups of people. The staff  seems to even prefer the larger groups, probably because they tip better.   The menu has lots of specials that cater to large tables. Depending on the day, you can get two for one pizza deals or a large with 30 wings.   The wings are a little on the crispy side, but you never get the wimpy little "mini wings" that places like Buffalo Wild Wings or Domino's try to screw you with when you order large batches.   The pizza's chock full of grease, but it's filling and tastes pretty damn good. I recommend the Chicken Alfredo pizza if you ever get a chance. On Wednesdays it's two for one, last I checked.  I'm sure there's other stuff on the menu, but I wouldn't bother. It's a pizza place.   There's a reason why nobody buys tacos at Burger King.

g226iDUO5LX89QEjB-Wo7w.text: Having recently moved to the neighborhood, I'm on the prowl for a new pizza place. I was looking for one that delivered, but Pullano's is close enough for pick up, and I read good things about it, so I thought I'd give it a shot.  I probably should have stuck with pizza. But we were in the mood for a full, homestyle meal. We ordered a veal parmesan, a chicken parmensan, two wedding soups, and a burger for the kid.   The fact that they had burgers should have been a minor warning sign. The fact that they also have a full Mexican food menu should have been a great big honkin' neon sign.  Like most places in the Valley, Pullano's is tucked in a shabby strip mall. Inside, it's very cheery and friendly. The walls are chocked full of sports memorabilia from the local teams they support, as well as some knickknacks, and TVs airing sports. It's been around a while, and that made it rather comfortable and neighborhoody.  The staff was all smiles, and after a short wait, had my food ready to go. The price for our meal was around $30. Not bad.  Once I got it home and unwrapped it, well, yeah. The veal parm was one of those chopped and re-formed patties, dowsed in a bland tomato sauce, and topped with mozzarella. The chicken was an actual chicken breast, served in the same way, but had the texture of a dog's chew toy (not that I've actually tried one.)  On a bright note, the italian wedding soup was really rather good. In fact, we have toyed with the idea of ordering from Pullano's again -- but just soup and garlic bread. Or maybe a pizza.

XvF1hUcQzRmdUlFJkf-xWA.text: This pizza place reminds me of my childhood in the burbs of Chi-town.  It's a warm and friendly place to be with multiple TVs blaring the current football game, patrons and fans cheering with every touchdown and piping hot pizza right from the oven! They even have 2-4-1 meal nights!   This is the place for your pitcher of bud and your favorite team jersey,  Oh, and don't worry, no need to dress up or find yourself a baby sitter.

mcKTsBjlDUHLMro3rHhpuw.text: without regoing to this place i will raise my rating based on what Ive heard from others who are fans of their food. When I attended the pizza seemed to be popular, staff was friendly.

nUwgV8_csjVRKOm6KEW7Ug.text: Went to their private Superbowl party. Paid 50 bucks for the party. Last year it was good, lots of swag and prizes and drink specials and only 40 bucks. This year with the price increase, no drink specials, no swag, and no door prizes. The halftime smorg was only a salad, three types of chicken wings, half cut sandwiches, and some pasta and a gross pizza that was really greasy. The best part was the chips and dip with with the mixed nuts provided as snacks and chips and salsa. The gross part was people smoking e cigarettes at the bar. For the 50 bucks that they charged was not only outrageous for what they served, I think in my opinion it was criminal. Shame on me for going back and thinking it would be better than last year. Normally the established restaurants want to better the experience from the previous years.  I will not be going back anymore. Will be spending my cash at other reputable established places. To bad, used to go for there for years. Never again.? To bad Yelp only says 1 star is the worst you can rate.

rsZQTvCkoVloY7i5M_DQtA.text: I grew up in Glendale and my parents would have Friday Pizza night, where we would get take out from Pullano's. I now live within proximity of Manhattan and have access to really great pizza. I try to swing by Pullano's when I am back in town, and I have to say that that the pizza still holds up after all of this time. It's nothing like the New York style pizza, but it's always really good. They have a thick crust, with a house made tomato sauce (that at times can be on the sweet side). They have a tendency to overdo it with the cheese but it still comes together well. I think it's a testament to the fresh ingredients. Overall, the menu is expansive and does not disappoint. See you guys next time I am in town!

lSpC6lJ9SJk3o6zhPasHNw.text: Pullano's is my favorite bar/hang out in the area. I used to live across the street so it was awesome to be able to walk across the street, drink more dollar pints than you could count (they're 2 dollars now, but still a steal), and get free pizza. The pizza is great (not the best in Phoenix, but authentic greasy goodness), and the wings are AWESOME (don't miss 40 cent wing night on Mondays). As mention in another review the owner is there much of the time, he's even thrown a few bucks in the juke box and let me choose the music. If you went to Maryvale HS or Moon Valley HS be sure to be at the reunion nights that the owner hosts, as they're bound to be better than the real thing. Be sure to check out all of the specials: pullanos.com

fQ07WAP-pXIDORVaSDuBZw.text: Ohhhhh ya! This pizza place is legit. The husband has eaten here several times since it's near his work, and he finally brought me a few weeks ago. When you approach, you don't know what to expect.... It looks like a semi divey sports bar from the outside. Inside, you get the feel of a real east coast pizzeria.... You know, red checked plastic tablecloths.... Nothing fancy. We got the pizza and wings combo (which is offered everyday and saves a couple bucks from their separate prices). We got the hot wings, though they have like 20 flavors of sauce. The hot wings were some of the best in town. The chicken was perfectly fried, juicy on the inside and slightly crunchy on the outside and the sauce was your typical hot wing sauce. This would be a must order. The pizza was also awesome.... Definitely not a fancy pizza.... It reminded me of Barro's a bit, because it had a puffier crust than your typical new york pizza, but it tasted better than Barro's. We had pepperoni and ricotta on the pizza, and it was sinfully tasty. This is the place to go in the west valley when you're feeling like a solid 'classic' pizza. Only downside is the price is a little high, but not terrible. Put this place on your to try list!

FJdWqCScJVuTDE0zyoS9pA.text: This place is awesome. Consistently great food and excellent service. If you're a Bills fan take a peak in the dining room!!!

bsIDLgBJzjmw03D0qFgSAQ.text: If I could give a million stars, I would! My boyfriend, his friend and I have been going to Pullano's every Thursday for over a year now! We plan everything around going to this delicious establishment and seeing all the friendly staff. I have never had a horrible or even close to bad experience here, as the servers always make sure everything is to our liking and are always on top of our order/drinks, not to mention the amazingly delicious honey hot wings and Pullano special! In particular, we always make sure to sit in Stacey's section, as she has definitely upped our experience to make sure we feel at home and are a part of the Pullano family. However, on the days she is not there, we still know to expect a friendly welcoming, as that is the expected standard we have come to known with Pullano's. If you have not tried this place out, YOU ARE MISSING OUT! This Phoenix staple is definitely something to stick around in our Thursday tradition.

ZKCAgvB65wsZH4g-Q_MGSg.text: Really good food. A little on the pricey side at first, but their helpings are huge so we took doggie bags home and got two meals out of it. Service was excellent.

_I304nDhZCz5f8hrm4l43A.text: Update: rode our bikes here for dinner tonight and locked them on the bike rack out front. While we were enjoying our meal, someone stole the headlamps and tail lights off of our bicycles... very disappointing.  My 4-stars for Pullano's is still a valid rating, as they had nothing to do with the theft.

0BJNMCrfcSNdXuQVCJ2-aA.text: The ultimate pizza and wing spot in the area...the wings are UNREAL! I always go for half hot garlic Parmesan and half mango hab....the pizza is like no other....such a great crispy crunch to the bottom crust that makes the pizza amazing! Unlike any other!

WATHToNixWc782OrF5OOgw.text: I wasn't sure how to rate Pullano's. I'm a little torn. My experience was better than 3 stars but not quite as good as 4.  First, the staff were all very patient and friendly. We were a large party and not sure of what we wanted. We ended up with, a small order of breadsticks, 40 wings (half medium, half BBQ), 1 XL Pepperoni, 1 XL Pepperoni with green peppers.   Breadsticks were brought out soon after our drinks. 2 pitchers of beer, a few sodas. Breadsticks were hot, soft and dripping with butter. Yum! Served with a small cup of marinara that no one touched.  Wings came shortly after. Wings were above average size cooked to mosts liking. (I prefer a super crispy wing, most in our party did not) Sauces on the wings were outstanding. The medium was a really good balance of spice and vinegar tang. BBQ was smoky and sweet. The wings came the old fashioned way with celery and carrots, a nice touch. We had a split of ranch and blue cheese. Ranch was typical, but the blue cheese was strange to me. Don't get me wrong there was nothing wrong with it but t didn't taste like blue cheese. It had a peppery taste and was a creamy color.  Pizza arrived about 5-10 minutes after. The pizza is good but...I hate to say this but it had to much cheese. Yes, too much cheese. I love cheese but the crust on the pizza could not stand up to the weight of all of that cheese. The pizza crust is crispy on the outside, soft in the inside with a slight taste of yeast. The middle of the pizza was a soggy mess after sitting only a few minutes with the cheese barely melted in the middle. I would love that crust with just a smear of sauce and a sprinkling of cheese. Would be heaven on a pizza pan.  Restaurant could use a little scrubbing, but I have to say I enjoyed my first experience at Pullano's and will definitely make another trip.   They also have a small bar attached and there were several TV's in the dining room with football games on. A good place for families.

photos.caption: Photo of Pullano's Pizza & Wings - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pepperoni with green peppers

STTPCZLS7D2H0Ypv_txpWg.text: Horrible service...we waited 45 mins for some pizza ,  10 mins before anyone comes to Greet us, the waitress never asked about getting us refills , it's 3 of us ...she brings us the bill...we asked were our food, I thought you ate ...What, like me check..we finally get it ...pizza was good, waitstaff Just gave you guys a black eye...won't be returning

d7zsuHE-FGsM93COlsl9Sg.text: Awesome place! Great wings and pizza, great service in a laid back atmosphere. Went way out of way to eat here and we were not disappointed

P6nr4nhKfDw-3vfCFUDdUA.text: This is now my favorite wing place with sardellas and cheezeheadz being a close second.    Wings are always fried to perfection while the sauces are generously applied.   The pizza here is great. Ive also tried the salads and sandwiches. Both are great. Fresh ingredients with awesome taste.    I've taken friends here and they are always wanting to go back.

0p_VdBwxxAPBcqXNHDNazQ.text: 8/17/2018 Well we tried Pullano's again and well what can I say.  The food was the same good food, our server was great but the hostess was one of the rudest people I have dealt with At any restaurant I have been to.  Business must be great when you can turn business away like this girl did.  Good luck!  5/13/2018 So let me say the food is still worth the price at Pullano's.  Wings are the best around!  Service is pretty good however when they are busy it definitely suffers.  But no worries.   That said we went to Pullano's last week and when we got there we noticed sitting at another table was our neighbor.  So we asked if we could sit at the table next to them and they said sure.  Sat down everyone ordered simple order pizza, wing, salad and Drinks.  Pizza was wrong however not a big deal they were good about it as were we.  When dinner was over we noticed they only brought one bill for the entire table of 6.  Instead of giving us each our own bill or even asking if we wanted separate checks.  If they would have we would have wanted separate checks but again not a big deal just think it should be our choice.  Then I noticed that they added a separate line for a gratuity of 18%.  We asked about it and were told that because we were a party of 6 there was an automatic 18% added to the bill as a surcharge.  I asked you mean in place of a tip?  She stated no the tip is extra.  I reminded her that our friends were there first and we were even seated at a different table before we noticed they were there.  There should have been two separate checks as well as jo surcharge.  She then just simply asked if she could take our bill.  Two issues here.  1.  If in fact there is going to be a surcharge for a party it should be mentioned up front, not hidden at the back of the menu.  2.  If one party joins another party they should be informed before they move that a surcharge will be added if You sit with your friends.    I checked around and I don't see a lot of surcharges being added for 6 people.  Also remember this is a Mom and Pop pizza joint not Mastros City hall.  But trying to keep it positive the food was still great.

uABRl9QG7FF5HfWDub0-5Q.text: Restaurant super clean, location close to ASU West.  Service; Deb on restaurant side is amazing, super friendly and outgoing.  Food; always fresh and yummy.   Check for daily Specials

5LoIha_SUBezD4-bxE0DKA.text: Pullano's what happened?  Your wings were off the charts, now an order of extra crispy buffalo wings are soggy and just not as good (in the last year). The quality and taste justified the price ($$) for a pizza and wing joint, however, not so much anymore.   When the good wings come back, so will we.

xy9UrYp49i9y3QAKHI_wJg.text: Perfect neighborhood, locally owned spot. If you want great pizza (and i know pizza,) delicious wings, and friendly bartenders, you need to get in your car and go to Pullano's! Another get thing on the menu is the artichoke scampi, gotta get it. :)  This not only is a great place for some food that will really stick to your guts, but just a great place to go with friends, have some drinks and get on the juxbox!

auy8026rMPX5Uc8GRMCnGg.text: My confidant and I returned to Pullano's because we wanted to pregame night class (completely necessary). Our experience was much better this time around. I was much more pleased this time around, and I hope that our experiences continue to remain positive.

IjusnmP8Yad04dBG-ac6xQ.text: Great local dive bar, good food and drink specials. Don't feel like heading downtown, to scottsdale or somewhere far and just need to relax? This place is perfect.

E3iln0KTrRM2kJpY5Pt7DA.text: Love their food a ton but they don't accept American Express. I had holiday gift cards and those were turned away.

3n5FBkqDJAcar-S2hOagcQ.text: This pizza's a lot like Barros - greasy, salty and really fills you up. And to be honest, it's not my favorite. But the prices here make it totally worthwhile. I ordered takeout for a large with 1 one topping. Well they had a special for a cheese pizza for 5 bucks on Wednesdays. Total came out to 7 dollars and change for that extra topping (after tax) and I could barely get thru half!  I didn't have time to look at the bar side but the drink prices for happy hour are excellent. 99 cent domestic drafts on weekdays from 3 to 6pm. Also tons of food and drink specials on their website. I'd check this place out because it's so damn cheap, it's hard to knock it.

MTyX7rPl3dZiXC-zvZFxmQ.text: Omg these wings are the best around, and I will drive to get good wings. Thank god I only live 5 minutes away. Go on tuesdays for the wing special, get the rasp chipotle and jerk flavors and ask for Jessica. :)

oSn4Tx8uFMdgNsc9gZggCA.text: Fun place to eat.  The staff are so willing to meet your needs, including the effort of making a pizza (Taco Pizza) that is no longer on the menu.  An excellent pizza, I might add.  One of the best Taco Pizzas I have had the opportunity to try.  Some of the hot wings my hot wing loving family have had.  Will be going back very soon!!

kfu-VeGEsfR-FjCeKUzEdQ.text: Great pizza, probably some of the best I've ever had. They're specials are unbeatable. They're wings are good but the bone-ins had a couple deformities which I hate (broken bones, weird shapes, etc). The sauces are good so I usually just get boneless wings. iReBpP24BUSGsdYSkVHnPQ.text: Not a fancy place great pizza and wings.... I was very skeptical but Pullanos's pizza delivered 4 out of 5 easy.

1anRGl03jAsN5jmj_P3A5A.text: A five star review is very rare, this place deserves five stars though. There pizza and wings are amazing and I would recommend this place, and have recommended it to most of my friends. Good date place also!

1O04ifXRHnHa8eBxwlOMeA.text: I have been going here for about 3 years now. I love it. Great food, great happy hour prices. I wish they had a half-pound option for boneless wings because I never finish the full pound. That's my only complaint though. This is my spot for football too, go cardinals!

0OFBEDQlBhHgd8titY4Hig.text: First time at Pullano's.  My husband was raving about it and has been eating there for years.  We didn't eat in, we just ordered and went and picked it up.  We got an extra large pepperoni and sausage pizza, mild wings, my daughter got the buffalo chicken sandwich with fries and tiramisu for dessert.  The pizza was awesome, one of the better pizza's I have ever had.  However, my daughter and I were disappointed with the wings.  Although, they were good size and meaty there was no wing sauce on them and they were not very crispy at all.  It was like eating a "naked" wing, not our favorite.  The only "sauce" was this thin greasy like juice sitting in the bottom of the container.    The dessert was FANTASTIC!!!!!  After seeing in the menu that the tiramisu was imported by a family member from Italy I just had to try it and I was so glad that I did!  The tiramisu comes in a decent size cup and the cost is $4.99, but it is well worth it!   Even though our experience with the wings was not to good, I am willing to try them one more time and see if maybe it was a fluke and someone overlooked putting the sauce on the wings.  Overall, the food was great and we will for sure return to Pullano's in the future!

hcbuiCs-Exd50QrypVYZpA.text: I love this restaurant. The waitstaff is polite and fast. They have different specials every day. The portions are huge, which can be good or bad. One entree can usually easily feed two people.  The bar half of the restaurant is a lot of fun. On weekends after 10pm, they have great deals on beer and free pizza!

njMbOi309FpO0UDF2OPCOQ.text: Ive been here three times.. and I think I can finally make an honest review.    I don't care what pizza you've had, or what sandwich you've eaten, or what wing you've devoured.  You MUST try Pullano's.  For years my favorite NY style pizza has been NYPD Pizza (valley-wide).  Well NYPD... you've been dethroned!.   I just moved from Chandler to Glendale and happen to live about a block away from this haven.  As we all moved in to the new place, we ordered Pullano's to go.  We got three pizzas and 40 wings.  Let me tell ya.. if it weren't for the people around me, I could have eaten 24 wings by myself and the a few slices of pizza.  But damn.. i had to share.  I had one slice of the delicious meat lovers pizza and about 6 wings.  It reminded me of the first time I've ever eaten a good slice of pizza and wings.    We went last night for their $5 large cheese pizza night (Wed) and being new to this place, I had no idea why it was so packed (duh), til I saw the special.  We waited for about 10min and were seated.  Jessica was our server and took awesome care of us.  I love it when the servers become your friends and make sure you have the greatest time. Jessica was awesome.  Also being Christmas time, someone was passing around cheese balls. I want to say it was the owner? (because he looks like the owner).  Yum!  We had a great experience, and Im happy to say I found a new favorite pizza place.  Thank you Pullano's!!

bwQf__cVmv3vQMXu1OeEUQ.text: Very good pizza and wings. It was packed so my fiance and I had to sit in the very back tiny corner. (Hostess asked if we minded, to be fair.) I've had better antipasta.. But the pizza and wings make up for that. Yum.

h0w_7KSFcNdmOs-Ko4nqVA.text: Used to love the wings, but the pizza was so so.  Went there when my favorite place was closed. Sorry we did. They overcharged us, gave us the wrong pizza and shorted our wing order.  When I went back to return the pizza they didn't even know how to do a refund. On top of that they were rude about it. Never again.

pAFcGVjwRNezEbd2lnQOhQ.text: Simply put, my favorite place for pizza, pasta, atmosphere and service in the greater Phoenix area.  My family and I are in 3-4 days a week because we love the food and the staff is the best around.  the Sunday breakfast is awesome...lots of great choice and very inexpensive.  Same with 1/2 off pasta Tuesday.  The pasta is home made and the sauces are delicious!  It's a must if you are in the area!  ~ Rod Cooper

mdgtjnroiw4hoFHYdcTEog.text: The Pizza is okay you can find better down the street at Rays. But the wing selection, good drink selection and the always lively bar section make this place worth going back to.

E_v-cdVUP_6h7Fff4VB5tw.text: I had never heard of Pullano's before tonight and decided to try this place out because we had a great value coupon.  My fiance loved the spaghetti and the meatballs were really good. The pizza however was just OK. It had an odd sauce that was too salty, although it wasn't necessarily bad. The bread sticks were nothing to get excited over.  The restaurant itself looked like a lot of fun, but we ordered take-out. We decided that this place was a little expensive for what it was and it probably isn't somewhere we would go without a coupon.

CmBDdhBoDodkcF88csYieA.text: Good place to hang out and have beers with the guys. Your nightly little pizza buffet is a nice addition. Italian food here is bad but the pizza stands out
