b2FgjJmRL2_eJTE0fecfAQ.text: Ok so I had a beer here several years ago. Didn't think much about it since. Tonight I stopped for dinner. The food is great, service is great. Try the Italian sub, wings, pizza you can't go wrong. They have been in business for years and know what they are doing. Just cool to see local ownership keep it going this long. The menu is quite large and I look forward to coming back to try more of it!!

Kd2Nq9VHhrnovjGBRYdiCw.text: This place doesn't need Yelp's blessings or review because it's been here for a 1,000 years and thanks to the food & drink, will be here for a 1,000 more.  Huge menu with tons of stuff but pizza & wings are the star. Prices are the co-star. We weren't there for happy hour but methinks if you want to get happy (beer) & full (pizza) for not a lot of money, this is the place to do it.  They even have an appetizer that made me like artichokes. (And I HATE artichokes) I think the secret ingredient is magic. Also, perhaps copious amounts of butter.  Family-run operation that definitely appears to be a labor of love --- I put this on my Mt. Rushmore of Italian-style eateries in town (along with Uncle Sam's and Santisi Brothers) -- but you can't beat the bang for your buck.

rSrLpLaxPWOVm7iND__UyA.text: My family and I are regulars here at Pullano's, and we love it. The mozzarella sticks are delicious, and the pizza is pretty standard and greasy but still good. This is the perfect place to watch football or any other sporting event, with a few big-screen TV's around the dining room area. The decor is reminiscent of an old-school pizza parlor with the red-checkered table cloths. Overall good food, reasonable prices, and a nice family environment. My only complaint? The service.  SO SLOW.They never refill our   drinks, and half the time three different people are serving you. Good luck knowing who your server is! If the service was more consistent, I would rate this place 5 stars.

-Lt0wu8KKASfPyVWI--Oeg.text: Great food! Wonderful Service! Fun Atmosphere.  They graciously accomodated our large party at the last minute.  Our girls volleyball team had a great time.

rpiWv4mjJBhWDelm09Eetw.text: I've definitely had better pizza. I ordered half peperoni/pineapple & half combo. Like others have said, the toppings DO fall off. Even the pineapple was falling off which shouldn't happen... The mushrooms on the combo side were from a can in water. They were pure white and floppy; I picked them off. The pizza was Extremely greasy, like overly greasy. The crust tasted similar to Domino's. I would not recommend this place.

KVvGhZuo17ihHDAFmF9IDg.text: Wings are great! Gf and I got the medium and garlic parm to split. Both were amazing. Got ranch for the side and it was really good too. Not too thick and not watered down. Drinks were huge and their ice tea is really good. I got lemon and it even looked good. A big slice and it was juicy. (I'm picky) We also got the bacon jalapeno popper and they were super good. Been driving by this place for 5 years and never stopped in to eat...stupid. We'll be back!

uiFt0jxcgf-Txwn-g8ILxw.text: I've been going here for years. First, it started in the 1990s with pizza and wings takeout.  Their wings are the best.  I usually get medium.   Wed and Thurs nights are currently my favorite.  Wed is $6 large cheese pizza night, and Thurs is wing night.  The service, at least when I have gone, has always been polite and attentive.  Food is delivered in a reasonable time.  I mainly eat int he restaurant, but have been in the bar.  I also have tried their pasta, and their spaghetti is awesome, as well as their lasagne. Their subs are great too, except the Phili cheese steak  is not quite a Phili...more just a cheese steak with yellow cheese and no mushrooms or peppers, but is still pretty good. The bar has a burger and beer special for $5, and the burger is great.

lon74U_8N_a0HDgCEf4IRQ.text: I've been coming here for quite some time with my boyfriend, his dad, and friends. This bar is our all time favorite to watch football, UFC, or to just come and chill. If you come be sure to get Erika or Laura. They have TVs everywhere, so wherever you sit you'll have a great seat. The prices are good, so drink away. If you come during the week they have awesome specials too! Be sure to stop by and check it out.

Ivt4PTTU148ZxNB3wCEX7A.text: walked in thinking i would simply order a pizza to go. WRONG!! after being greeted by shelby, i bellied up to the bar, ordered a beer, ordered my pizza, and then ordered spicy chicken dingers while i waited. best way to end a friday, i think. thanks, pullano's!!

4t6oaZwGW5b-4lzDZpIs2Q.text: Still find Pullano's Pizza & Wings the most amazing place in Arizona!  Our family absolutely loves "Friday Night - Movie Night"  It wouldn't be the same without Pullano's  (Oh, their chef salad's are amazing!)

I7P8PdjI3VTbm7P13ExsoQ.text: The bar is separate from the restaurant.  I was in the bar and man, did it get rowdy.  The food was good.  Great selection of booze.  Friendly service.  The place could use some serious cleaning though.

nbl4VjjhcJLOdYM0eRe1og.text: We love coming here. Pizza and wings are great! The daily special they have for the wings and pizza is a decent price too. You have to try the pickles in the jar. My mouth is watering as I write this. The hot pickles are tasty.

k2ToJAocmVdwwYNH0qwo5A.text: The wife and I have been there many times, Pullano's doesn't disappoint! Incredible food and an All-star staff! The front of the house as well as the back...This crew is on point! Keep up the great work.

HoTG7kbb9ao01oKSMQjEXQ.text: I flat out love this place. The Happy Hour here is probably one of the best Happy Hours around this area.  The pizza is delicious. The bruschetta is amazing. Some friends and I went to Pullano's for lunch a few days ago and decided to try the Pepperoni chips (which I guess is a new appetizer they've got going on), anyway, if you're one of those people who will pick off the crispy pepperoni on your pizza and eat those first, this appetizer is definitely for you. They also have these really great buffalo mozzarella sticks. YUM!  Anywho, the staff is friendly and pretty fast.

f4Vf9X8npR9wb_zPQZegwA.text: Absolutely awesome. This is not some cheap pizza joint. An almost overwhelming menu full of many many choices. Not the cheapest but definitely the best.

2ik74YHmL3aX18nWX0Ge9g.text: This place is a great neighborhood bar with a separate side for the restaurant. It's also family owned which is always a plus in by book!   I've been here too many times to count and have tried over half of their menu. They have the best wings! I like mine pretty hot and I still go with medium here. Their antipasti salad is a must try, with the house Italian dressing. My least favorite thing on the menu is actually the pizza. It's pretty good, just not one of my favorites. All of their pasta dishes are good and I love their soups.   And for dessert, don't miss the pullokie!!!

p8YpVsoaHY77yNibK2Y__g.text: What can I say, this place always hits the spot , the best pizza and wings in town . Great service and love the atmosphere.

IIOcvAPvJPVNH38gAOPKuw.text: I am very unhappy with this restaurant now been coming here for years with my family. The  pizza was amazing and the wings were. Now everything is cheap and disgusting. My father used to get the chefs salad that cost 15 dollars about that price and we got it again and i like a side salad for the same price 15 dollars. That salad used to be huge now they are going cheap. The og owners would be heart broken about what this plave has became. Very crowded the tables r very small and 4 seater r really 2 seaters. Will not be coming back

hTOJXYUlQ_FRJQ76S25zKQ.text: We normally come to Pullano's 4 times a month. Tonight I decided to get take out and bring it home for family who have never been here before. When I got home I noticed that the pizza was cold (preordered for it to be ready an hour and a half after I called). I called and spoke to the manager, Paula. She was amazing and offered to replace my order! Couldn't have asked for better service. My family loved it and can't wait to have Pullano's again!

HfnvVFuYKYSQOqXwD264AQ.text: Beef 'n weck in AZ??!!  Yes sir/maam.  A True buffalo bar and restaurant. Good hometown flavor and family friendly.

kcgoAP6lobfq0DH2WXq3dQ.text: Great Pizza Best wing selection for original style wings and not a franchise. Upper New York, remanicent for sure less the snow.

TSP7umMd_Rp4zr3zYZBeFw.text: Me and my roommate order subs Italian sub and a steak and cheese as we where waiting we went in to the bar area and had a few drinks until are order was done when we got home we ate our dinner hands down these subs are the best and well worth the hard earned money that we both work very hard for  I love this place you all need to check it out you will not be disappointed please trust me !!!!

IM3uCUu1qfIrXhRAUNpCxg.text: I think I have decided Pullano's has made it in to my top 3 pizza places in AZ... It has all my favorites in a New York Style Pizza. The cheese is stringy and plentiful, the crust is crispy and sweet, and there are always tons of  toppings. I've also had the wings and cheese curds and both were also fabulous. It's hard to get good cheese curds anywhere in AZ. I'd say these are not the best I have had but they are pretty close. The wings are large, crispy, and always have tons of sauce, and tons of fun and delicious sauces at that. I always forget that they have really great weekly deals, so maybe look those up before you give them a try. They have a deal where you get a free personal Pizza with purchase of a beverage, a buy one get one 50% off Italian meal, and tons more. And if you are looking for a good dive bar there is one attached to the main dinning room that is always poppin.

mgYBAX88faAJZvCpN_wGCA.text: We have been going to Pullano's for years and usually order the cod, pasta dishes or pizza. This time I decided to try the jerk chicken wings. They were good, but I would probably try one of the other options if I ordered wings again.  I promised Lil Deb I would give her a shout out for her service and this is it. She was as patient as she good be with me considering how busy she was. I couldn't make up my mind which style of wings to get, which beer to order or which dressing - ranch or blue cheese. Both of us have worked in a restaurant when younger and know how hard a job it is. Any job that deals directly with the public has its challenges, so here's to you Lil Deb.  The food was delectable and the service memorable.

gOsQ7Neb0WQ55nutsUPR2A.text: I feel this just keeps getting worse.  Expensive wings that were cold and old. Used to be so good.  Service is slow and forgetful.

y-A3_NiH8nLJ_eDCrkplNg.text: I upped my review to four based on several more stops, a few more dishes tried and the fact they support our community. I like the meatballs and Italian sausage.Happy hour is awesome. They give out free food.

jLmUW7BRMYqLGdWkEaxFkA.text: I've been going to Pullano's for years and their food was always amazing but over the last year every time we go the food is horrible. Pizza is usually thin as a paper and has little to no flavor. The wings are extremely dry and over cooked. I still keep going back hoping they will redeem themselves but no such luck. Then one of our visits it was my husband and our kids and 2 of their friends and the waitress had the nerve to charge gratuity saying "the system automatically adds it of parties 8 of more" which I could understand but not with a party of 6 kids! I've worked as a waitress myself and usually parties of 8 or more adults we could add it. I also feel like their prices are a little outrageous, I know they have to accommodate for the minimum wage raise but still feel like it's a little to pricey.

y_4dwcykO03G9iCMSEEBOA.text: First time in, my friend and i accidentally ordered with the togo girl. Once we realized we could dine in we nicely asked the two hostesses if we could use a table and they older lady told us no and that we can't sit in dine in since we already ordered... she was very rude and direct, she acted like she didnt want to deal with us.. we didn't need a server rather just a place to eat our food, currently in the parking lot eating our pizza.... just needed a table, not impressed and not gonna come back.

-ETE4CXkjBIjJxgxeNMQYA.text: Tasty food and delicious wings are served here. I enjoyed their ravioli several times and the pizza. The location is easy to get to and the service is friendly and fast. A very nice group of people have taken care of us. If your looking for a quiet spot this isn't it. The portions are large so you'll probably need a to go box. I'm a fan of local places, good food and most importantly nice people. Give it a try.

sbDZxhYFQb6sAYNfOfnHNQ.text: So disappointed. This was one of our very favorite places to go for pizza, wings, crunchers, and even cheesesteak. Frequent diners and have referred friends. The last few pizzas have been very dry and overdone. Picked up an order For almost $50 on a busy Friday night. Pizza was super dry and overdone and not edible. Fortunately, the boneless wings and the crunchers were great so we still had dinner. Pizza went in the trash. Called and spoke to manager on duty and left a message for the owners. We are not ones to call and complain but felt that a restaurant should do something for us, issue credit, etc. An owner called me and offered to send me a gift card. I was very pleasant to all that I spoke to and very diplomatic and thankful. We did enjoy this restaurant. In today's mail, we received a $10 gift card. $10. Anyone who eats here knows that you can't buy much for $10 and an extra large pizza without toppings is 13.99. Wow. I am only rating three stars as the food is normally very good. Unfortunately, this experience is forcing us to find a new pizza and wing place in the West Valley. Wait staff has almost always been great, especially Michele. So long, Pullano's. I wish I could say that the $10 gift card was a nice gesture, but it really didn't sit well.

R9VGBw-yQzvwNLt6KCBCuQ.text: Mom & Pop Pizza shop is winning!  Though we arrived late ~8:45pm ,  the staff was happy to seat and serve us. They have daily specials (Mondays 25% off reg price bill, BOGO pizza, plus more).  The menu is full and includes pizza, wings, salads, calzones etc.  The main dining room (entrance on the east side of the building) is perfect for kids and is large enough for sports teams.  The bar entrance is on the south side of the building.  My hungry family of four shared a cheese bread app, Lg Pizza and 12 wings and brought home plenty of left overs.  My son especially liked the lemonade.  A little on the pricey side but we definitely got what we paid for,  the food was great!  There were plenty of TVS for us to watch the Plays of the Day.

olWSL_AOtLmUR2TEN3bUPg.text: Classic Italian food done right. From their pasta dishes, pizza and subs, you can't go wrong here. I haven't had a meal here that wasn't amazing. Best red sauce! They have great daily food specials, too. Also, the bar area has really good drink specials almost daily. As in $1 bottled beers and free pizza at certain times (if you've ordered a drink, of course). Service is super, the employees here are always friendly and attentive. I really like this place :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pullano's Pizza & Wings - Glendale, AZ, United States. Full bar, excellent daily specials

EYbS80-9DXTL_8EcCZ5uyw.text: Pullano's has been nothing short of wonderful. From the food , to the drinks , to the down right awesome people who not only work here but , also the patrons. I love the warm and welcome feeling that I get when walking in the door. Kim and Shelly always take the best care of me and all my crazy friends. Karaoke saturday with HOT FRESH PIZZA being placed out for you to grub A dubb up on. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to have some wholesome dive bar fun . If you are in the mood to take the kids to dinner they do offer a family friendly restaurant side apart from the sports bar . I would highly recommend the garlic artichoke scampi (personal fave) - Enjoy :) Britt

h1bHgNY4O-QoHQQ2xIs6wQ.text: Oreganos prices for fast food quality.  If you are looking for NY style pizza this is simply not the place. The pizza isnt bad, but it is far from good and here is why. Quality and quantity. The truth is, I will HAPPILY take a 8 dollars domino pizza over their large pizza (& they are the same size!) This pizza honestly had too much dough and tasted yeasty. I asked my husband if it smelled like it had beer spilled on it - the dough is not great. The taste profile is VERY similar to papa johns. Furthermore, our large pizza cost 16+ bucks. You can go to Luna pizza and get an Extra large pizza, which is double the size for that price. Rays pizza gives you more pizza for cheaper. Look, if they lowered their price it wouldnt be TERRIBLE, or if they increased the amount of food you are getting. However, as it stands the pizza and wings are mediocre. Pizza: too expensive and tastes like papa johns. Crust is too thick to be a True NYC pizza. Boneless Wings: Not bad, however, they are VERY shy with the sauce. May as well calls these chicken nuggets. 14 inch pizza(half pep) & 1lbs boneless wings(roughly 16 wings) 27 bucks. Zucchini: Perhaps the only good thing on the menu, however for about 16 coins of zucchini you will pay 10 bucks. Hands down the most expensive price we have seen. Ranch: probably the best thing we had. Very comparable to Anzios.

f6AwKj9ijAkeKp_5ZymeyQ.text: Awesome pizza and wings Great selection of sauces for the wings which are always big and meaty  Bruschetta is the best I've ever had Always great for large parties of people and the only place I've traded wings with a stranger

T5dR4dFxEWMgJTnRhCPuKg.text: Very delicious pizza. The wings were also good. We were at the "bar" section. It was fun and friendly. The server was friendly too.

JTr0rbYL_8q4FLn3Wb0wew.text: I have been going here for years. All of the waitresses are wonderful and MR. Pullano and his wife are some of the nicest and most respected business owners i have ever met. Great prices on beer and food and a fun neutral place to hang out. PS THANKS FOR THE ITALIAN DRESSING ITS AMAZING

CouMowExYzZCcgD1PuK0Tw.text: It's ok. Love their antipasta .. Wings are good..sauce on pizza is a little too thick for me

7V4VEVKD0H-9QVYrkEx_-A.text: Overall, this place is alright and gets the job done. Pizza and wings are their specialty and I can't really find a reason to criticize! Well, save for a couple of key points...  I found the sauce on the wings very watery and fluid rather than viscous and sweet, It gave the wings a very slimy texture in my mouth that just didn't feel right. I'm hoping that that was just a fluke on their part.  Ordered a supreme pizza. The ingredients on it were a mixed bag. The usuals, veggies, pepperoni, mushroom. Oooh shout out to the mushrooms which were actually very very good! And finally, the pizza dough was baked extra crispy so every bite had a satisfying crunch sensation that's so easy to rave about! =)  Also, I hear this place has killer happy hour specials and I'll be back I'm sure eventually and hopefully I can bump this place one star up if they redeem their wings!

KcTBT6aBIbhmXHEHJM3hvQ.text: We love the wings and pizza at Pullano's! The wings are crispy and delicious and the pizza sauce has great flavor.

H85f7LviwHsHhF4-s74pfA.text: I've been here too many times to count. Amazing food, good service(can be slow if they are packed) and good drinks. Havemt been there in a little while. Maybe it's time to take a trip back.

WKZq88qse2fvo1enpIPPcw.text: Bruschetta is the best in town as advertised. Cheese curds, wings, pizza and Beer what more could anyone ask for. If you love good food and good times then this is your place.

davxY6w8WEFsCvfXzdaVLg.text: I love this place. Awesome food, great drink selection. Day or night the place is good. If your looking to just grab some pizza or drink some beers they have a bar side if your trying watch the game and okay pool or have a late night drink with your friends. I go here all the time for drinks cause it's right across the street from my place and it's cheap beer. Also bartenders are always super nice or cool! Have a jukebox you can play your own music so that's pretty sweet too!

KFrjvqFimYdz5QRTDV0kOA.text: Pullano's has absolutely great wings. I visit them on almost a weekly basis and i'm always happy with the food.

Xw7Ety-wkqMIAziD8z4qcw.text: Fun night meeting new people with my fiance.  We had a fun group of karaoke going on!  I hope the lady that fell and bumped her head is okay.  You never want to see the EMT's wheeling someone away. :-(

p19MDzQnQS3oVevN1eXPew.text: Pullanos is the only pizza we get when we are craving pizza. Light sauce, whatever toppings I'm feeling, and well done crust is always my order. Their specials and pizza give it four stars, I've had hit and misses with their wings, sometimes they are amazing white meat pieces but I sometimes get a funky over breaded piece or something like cartilage. So can't miss pizza and some friendly service and good appetizers is how I see them.

X6lTVdxQ-rP4P9EBZg02cg.text: I live near and go to this place often as well as get take out.  The food there is good and I just tried for the first time, cheese curds. They are delicious. But recently when I went in to eat lunch I was informed that they had a new menu and they no longer serve the giant slice. This in my opinion was a staple of pullanos. I feel there are other pizza places that I will give a try. Hopefully they read this and bring back the giant slice.

5-4NGUDFu1nKQtuSnOcehQ.text: OK,  Mike, you're awesome, thanks for doing it again. Spaghetti was way better this time.

og9qxnUyaDMBy5yTymjpCQ.text: Been a patron of this place for over 20 years ....best pizza and wings in the valley !  Always a priced right happy hour in the bar and if your timing is right a pizza or two will be brought out .... Owner Mike is a great guy and does what it takes to earn your business .... If youve never been its a must ...pizza and wings will blow you away !!

MHa88apBiKQuGZlTAshOIw.text: Awesome pizza. We ordered the 30" pizza after a family trip and the kids all raved about how delicious it was. Can't wait to try dine in next.

u-Rm1b5oqYa6KUHtl8glJw.text: I have been coming here for YEARS! they have great wings, cheap beer and a dive bar vibe that is easy to chill in. I'm a fan.

BGX9ZHe4PFBESKDctxHIyg.text: One of my favorite places to go! They have great friendly service! Delicious food! And they always have a smile on their faces!! Good variety of food but not too overwhelming! You can also call ahead for a pick up order! The wings are to die for! And the pizza tastes perfectly homemade from fresh ingredients!

96GIrfJrtoJaLEvrxAuGJA.text: Love their wings!! Always friendly staff great local neighborhood hangout watch the game and relax..... Beware however if the Bills are playing your not going to find a seat until that game is over Lol Enjoy!!!

2MI0eQSo1B4Za4CzUBmVOw.text: Great cheese pizza and wings combo. The pizza is good and the wings are excellent; either flavor hot wings and bbq wings.  Super casual in a dumpy strip mall. Football on tvs, kid friendly and a bonus if you are a buffalo bills fan as that is their home team

SYxvdnNZrANJUj2fnd2pEg.text: Omggg Pullano's, where do I even start? First of all, this place is crazy close to us, which is a huge bonus :) Ever since "Daddy-O's" (gag me) took over Casey Jones (such a sad day), we've been looking for a new cheap bar that has a good atmosphere.  Enter: Pullano's! My boyfriend's brother told us about it and we finally went a couple of weeks ago... score!! We've been back twice since and, if we didn't keep ordering practically the entire menu and EATING IT ALL, we would go back more often...  The pizza? Awesome! Customize, order straight off the menu, whatever. Certain days they offer crazy specials on pizza (one special offers you a large pizza for free, if I recall correctly), so that's always worth looking into.  Great prices on pitchers of beer-- end of story. Get crunk (or watch your friends get crunk-- DDs are our friends!) on pitchers of beer from $9 (domestic) to $13.25 (seemingly everything else).  The servers are all young and very friendly, which is totally sweet. We've never had a mean or grumpy server-- huge plus. You may even get lucky and have one of the owners serve you, which is so cute, in my opinion.  Thursdays are the days to get wings (although I don't know if this changes...?? Call or check online). When we went (on a Thursday), wings were $.40 and, according to my boyfriend, really good.  I'm personally a fan of the pizza (duh) and the happy hour prices for appetizers-- um, $4 for a GIANT plate of bruschetta? Yeah, sign me up!  The only "downsides", if you can call it that, is that the place is ALWAYS busy. We've gone on a Thursday night, a Saturday around 3 p.m, and a Friday around 8... not "dead" times but not exactly hopping... but Pullano's was BUSY. Be prepared to wait 5 min. more and have to maneuver around large parties (that inexplicably like to push their chairs into the aisle...)  The other thing is the menu--- holy crap. Be prepared to sit there for a solid 10 min. trying to understand it all if its your first time there. The menu is HUGE and the print is really tiny. I mean, I'm practically blind, so take that with a grain of salt, but still. It's tiny print. Just be warned.  That said-- don't go. This is my bar, y'all ;)

HTSxcSzA7sIk8vnm1UKquQ.text: This is our first visit. We had antipasto salad, wings, French fries with garlic and Parmesan cheese, garlic bread. Everything was very tasty. I would have liked more cheese on salad, but that's personal preference. The server was very attentive. We would definitely come back and make it one our regular places.

mHnwrW1m9imavZpVXC2k-w.text: I have been coming to Pullano's pizza since 1988.......and it is still as good as ever...the appetizer Bruchetta is a big serving for a big party too much for two people but we tried...the pizza well nice crust and nice texture and crispy And the WINGS ... I can't go there without getting some me some wings... everything consistently good...remember it's a sports type restaurant!!! Have fun!!!

4rS3FMUr1qZW1FRv-evbGQ.text: I do not like posting critical reviews, but I feel like the rating was entirely misleading.   This food MAY be good if you are drunk, and the bill would probably be less horrifying.  The service was excellent and the waitstaff was friendly, so I added one star. The restaurant area was lackluster, but I did not really care (it's all about the food). We got 1lb of boneless wings, Mac and cheese bites, and zucchini and mushroom bites. The bill came out to $50. We could've had better food at a nicer place for that.  The Mac and Cheese bites tasted like fried Kraft brand. The zucchini bites were pretty good, but the mushrooms were so bad! I couldn't eat them. I'm finding it hard to describe how bad they were.  My husband got wings, and said they were okay.  The bill was outrageous and my food was abysmal. I feel ripped off. We would've been better off getting microwaved food from Trader Joe's.   I really wanted to like this place! I was glad the bar area was separate from the restaurant. Sober people beware.

XbKKWc2_ZYx0UZHx3jECTA.text: We came into this restaurant for about the 500th time (over the last 15 years) and were overcharged without warning.  We purchased a LocalFlavor certificate which we've done before over the years.  Rather than separating the bill for the different parties present, all of the specials and happy hour deals were marked back up to regular price for every person, not just the LocalFlavor holder.  Of course, this was never told to anyone in the group until after the fact so everyone's bill was penalized and overcharged.  This was finally disclosed AFTER the certificate was redeemed and the owner's daughter (acting manager) refused to re-ring it.  Net result: everyone WAY overpaid for their items unfairly and left unhappy without an ounce of remorse or understanding from management.  A restaurant can only rip me off once...never again.  Easy 1-star because there isn't a 0-star option.  This place used to be decent but now is definitely one to avoid.  **Update on 6/28 after Owner's response: Mike, we ordered an XL pizza and wings at full menu price in order to use our LocalFlavor certificate (not Groupon), nobody had a problem with that part.  The problem is your server never said that you would refuse to split the check up for the different parties in the group (something every restaurant in the world does), nor was there any mention that nobody would receive the happy hour pricing on their beers or appetizers because one person used his certificate for a regular priced pizza and wings.  He told the server immediately upon sitting down yet we were pitched $2 beer pints and half-priced appetizers by the server.  We were only told you wouldn't honor anything after the bill came and your manager refused to re-ring it.  Everyone was overcharged rather than the just the party that was apparently dumb enough to buy your LocalFlavor offering.  We literally paid you $10 for about 10 fried zucchini rings (obviously marked way up so you can do your half-price apps and have them make the slightest bit of pricing sense).  Even factoring in the one person's LocalFlavor certificate, we paid WAY over the retail pricing overall.  The worst part was your staff leading us to ordering things based on pricing they knew they weren't going to honor.  We were forced overpay after-the-fact because of the deception of your staff.  100% rip off and I will never step foot into your "restaurant" again.  Do they right thing and refund the money you stole.

zl5VMhYoriyK8FX1_WQ5SQ.text: I hate to do this as I love Pullanos but I'm not sure what keeps happening with the beer selection here.  It got better and then fell back to bad.  It is causing us to go other places just for the better selection.  It is that important.    To be blunt, Lagunitas and Deschutes are not good IPAs or even real craft breweries for that matter.  The stone keg is always empty.  Please get some real independent craft breweries in here.  Preferably local.  There are a ton of good ones out there.    Why is this so hard to do and keep going?  If your beer purveyor can't do it find a new one.  C'mon now.

5FzSxB5Mo0Q3cDtm4bVr-A.text: Half restaurant half bar. We sat on the restaurant side.   There's big TVs.   We ordered the wings. They were okay.   My brother got the Italian sub, Sherry's way. It was good. He got fries with it. My sister got the half turkey sub and side salad. The salad comes with tomatoes, olives, onions, croutons, lettuce & your choice of dressing. I got the cheese calzone, it was good. It tasted like a cheese pizza, there was sauce in it too. The marinara sauce that it comes with not that great.

hOQVJztYTSK6zlv3-u9UNA.text: Solid, affordable, pretty good little neighborhood pizza shop. Ordered a pizza and a calzone, pizza was really good the calzone was just ok.

qi0xK7EzC5A0FNVG_4PSPA.text: Best wings!! So much flair and a lot of meat to them! Pizza sauce was amazingly tasty! Best service ever too! Never went without anything! Kierra was amazing!!!

UH2tRdUT3YJ3MYlIHts-HA.text: Pullanoa is by far the best pizza and wing joint anywhere. I want to try their Italian food but that would mean I wouldn't be getting the pizza and wings and that'd be a problem. Get the hot garlic Parmesan wings and dip your crust in the sauce. Only mild complaint is the beer selection. Is a standard selection but if they had a couple beers that weren't so mainstream I'd never have to leave!

2BwDFxOeofAVyRenSOdsgg.text: Yum!   I think I found a new place down the road from me for good food and drinks. The menu had so many options it was hard to choose. Everything that went to tables by us looked so good. Their happy hour looks great! Can't wait to go back and try more options.   This was my first time, but not my friends. They love this place so I'm kinda mad they haven't taken me here before, haha!   Our server was soo nice and helpful. Our drinks were never empty (which I love about servers), and she made great recommendations. I was debating between lasagna, ziti or the spaghetti calzone. I asked my server what she'd pick and her face lit up with calzone so I knew it was good. I'm so glad I went with her recommendation. The calzone was soo good and so big I had to take half home. The portions are great for the price. You can definitely tell everything is homemade. We shared the boneless wings and wow they were good. The bone in wings looked good, but I rather use my fork so boneless it is. We had medium sauce and garlic parm which was such a good decision.   Overall, I loved it. My friends and I will definitely be back!

QWdh-MwWDAFAn_DJhrn6Gw.text: Update: my friend and I were told "YOU HAVE TO LEAVE" when we unknowingly ordered in the Togo line on our first time eating at the restaurant we figured it was like most pizza spots we are used to where you order first then sit down (Barros, round table, etc). We have waited 4 days to hear back from the OWNER and still can't get ahold of him only a voicemail saying they want to give me a free large cheese pizza that is 6$ on their special after spending near 30$ on food I was forced to eat in the car...NOT A FAIR DEAL.

bYLzWtCAYAZxXRCIx6X2Gw.text: First time trying Pullanos and it was great! I called to place an order for pizza and the girl over the phone was very friendly and helpful as I had some questions about the specials and the pizza.  We picked up our order just 15 minutes later.  The pizza was great, it was a little greasy, which we like, but definitely not too greasy. Flavor was great! The hot wings were also great, a good size, crispy and sauced just right. The sauce (hot) was so good!  We will definitely be ordering pizza and wings from Pullanos again!

Xp-B-FX-8b3bfvGbKfhJrw.text: I go there all the time, it's in my hood.  This is probably my last.  I literally told the manager Michelle that I was going to write them a bad review and they really didn't care.  I ordered 24 wings and got 36.  I asked to be charged full price for the wings I ordered, but NOPE!  I was to be charged for what I got.  I also bought a Groupon that I literally have NEVER been able to use for like 6 months.  Every time I try to use it, there's a reason why I can't.  You'll see other reviews very similar to mine.  Nothing new here.  They got 2 starts because the servers are good and food is decent.  If you ever have any issue, do not expect any customer service or resolution.

JRi_IoiBHburheGrYF3W3A.text: My Favorite place! Great food.. love this family!  Been coming here for years.. even when they delivered.. Hah I wish they still did..everything on the menu is awesome! If you haven't been, it's a must!! Don't miss out folks..

Yw127Iwi9krw21a4uwSJeg.text: The wings are AMAZING! Pizza is also very good! They have good deals on Wednesday. One of my all time favorite spots for wings.

jG7IxSgGxqAGZWI5Mb6MMw.text: Came in on a cold day and had the lunch special unlimited soup/salad/breadsticks. Definitely not like that other place that only gives you soup OR salad, and ten times better. Wedding soup was great and filling as I could only put away two bowls. The salad was massive and the Italian dressing was delicious. The breadsticks are soaked in butter and perfect for dunking into the wedding soup. Will definitely eat here again.

Wazw0VI0QtTx77v77Ud1DQ.text: We were hungry for pizza so with the good yelp reviews and close proximity to our Phoenix home we thought we would try Pullano's. It is a family owned Italian hang out kind of place. It has 3 sections; the sports bar area, dine in room and take out only section. We wanted take out so after just a bit of confusion of where we should be we ordered our pizza and had a short wait. The staff was excellent as was the pizza. They have many specials most  include wings. We will go back and get one of the specials. I really want to try their wings since that seems to be their signature dish.

UMztXOFWr5oACg2yclYSvw.text: 7 minutes for a server to finally greet us. 4 minutes to finally get my Pepsi and was told my husbands beer would be another minute. TEuJLjYBUBs5uiUKM7UYEQ.text: Just get on hither. It's a staple in the neighborhood of Glendale AZ. check out Bonitas restaurant also

LFkk5YIqjOed4cur6JN5_w.text: I'll put it this way.  I'm a tourist to this city.  When a local whom you trust with such questions tells me he goes here for late night booze and bites, I'm going.  Beer:  Cold, clean taps.  Have some.  Is the selection going to blow away my hipster pals?  No.  BUT, who's going to a perfectly dive-y place like this looking for hipster beer selection?  Booze:  Right down the middle.  Pouring fast and strong.  I. Like. It.  Now for the late night food:  They have free pop corn and pizza all night.  Let me say again.  Free: Pizza and popcorn.    Pool table: looks like it's been hit with a hammer a couple two three four(teen) times.  If you're cool with that and just want something to do while you eat free food and drink, then you're in for a great night.  Jukebox:  It's a fancy pants digital jukebox but you'll find all sorts of good drinking anthems and more.    Why would you not go here?  Because you prefer the sterile cavernous, loud, flashing light d-baggery that takes place near the stadium.  Let's be real if you're the type that really loves tucking into the Gordon Beirch horror show, I'm not sure you've got the stuff it takes to hang out here.  For the rest of you....cheers.

rcMT-zsK5wtdbVo7szouZA.text: It used to be I would go to this place for pizza and that place for wings never could I go to a place where I could get both. By that I mean just delicious and quality. The pizza the cheese so much of it it'll stretch to the exit crust is on point to me so good I almost forget about the quality wings and get too full. Now the wings when asked for crispy and that's what I got the sauce is good very good. it's vice versa with the wings if I start with the wings I forget about the pizza so I battle with a balance every time I eat here. In the end I always am satisfied.

VMw2_8zfSCC0MpNrr4ISzQ.text: I met a friend at Pullanos on a Monday night, and they were broadcasting MNF. There is two sides to the restaurant, a bar type side with high tables and lots of big flat screens, and then theres a dining side with long tables to accomodate large parties. We sat ourselves and our server Amber wasnt terribly quick to approach us, but she was nice.   After she took our drink order, another server came and asked us to move because she supposedly had some big party that was going to arrive. Now, we were sitting at a table that could accommodate a party. However, there was a perfectly fine table right behind ours that she could have sat them at, and left us alone. i could see if the place was super packed, but it wasnt, and they never even used that table that was behind us! it was completely open the whole night.  That pissed me off a good bit, and this is why i gave the 3 star rating instead of a 4.   Anyhow, our server brought the drinks and took our order. Now...i have a love affair with wings, and im starting to venture into the spicy side of life. so after consulting with Amber, i decided upon the Super Hot (or as the reciept says, XXXHot). The only difference between the Hot, and Super Hot is that they dont put butter into the sauce for Super Hot. Sounds like a peice of cake, right?  HELL NO.  it literally took me 30 min to finish 10 wings with this sauce on it. With snot in my nose and tears in my eyes, at wing no. 4 the midsize 2 alarm blaze in my mouth could only be smoldered with lots of ice, and sips of water. After that, i had to eat them one at a time, then take a break. Everytime our waitress came back to check on me, i was one wing less. I think she knew i was struggling, but she didnt laugh at me once. I did not leave that table till i finished them all, and i actually enjoyed the challenge (apparently the Super Hot is no. 3 on the totem pole. She said they have one with the Ghost pepper in it. Ouch). A gentleman sitting next to us ordered a VERY delicious looking pizza, along with two big bowls of wings. said it only costed him 25 or 30 bucks.   So if you love wings, and like em hot, you need to give this place a shot. The food was great tasting (and looking) and i would love to come back and try something else. the menu is huge so you have lots to choose from.

xLVYN0g0OXu1jm4ibHtYIg.text: It's hard to find places that have a fun atmosphere but also have delicious food that makes us come back each and every time. We have been going here since I was a kid and now I take my kids. The owners are great and the specials are sweet! :)

dz0MMm7r1EM6QvZDTttp-A.text: Their  wings & pizza are sooooo good . Will be coming here again . They also have lunch specials ! The setting is casual . Not too pricey either .

pDMaxrtKGA6YWo2bjuTC4w.text: Pullano's is a great place to come and can accommodate a few different moods.  The restaurant is divided into two separate parts that contain both a bar and formal dining area. Both of which are great atmospheres to have lunch/dinner.   The food here is great and the pricing is reasonable. A couple of great items on their menu are the Baked White Ziti and Dessert Pulookie. Both are fantastic.   On our last visit I had the chance to try the Bacon Mac' N ' CheeseBurger. WAY too much food for me in a sitting but I can tell you it was out of the ordinary and it tasted amazing.  Top notch food here and a great place to bring family and friends. I always look forward to getting the opportunity to come down to this place. Kudos.

X1yk2lZ5q2EV74VJmeTeYg.text: Great staff. People here are just wonderful, they really care about the experience and want you to enjoy your time in their restaraunt.  The food... not sure what to say. Execution needs some help. Everything is either just over cooked or barely undercooked. Maybe make the BOH a little happier, IDK. Something isnt right there.  Beer a restaraunt doesnt make.

UlafzXbygmcyzaG-nCRBEQ.text: Been here a bunch of times and absolutely love this place. I've never had a bad meal here and the wings I would argue are the best I've had in the valley. They are always cooked just the way I like them (super crispy on the outside but not dried out on the inside) and they have this Italian Dry Spice that I can't get enough of. Other favorites include their thin crust pizzas and a hot Italian sandwich that can literally feed two people.   They have awesome drink specials too! My wife and I would always go on Sundays because it was dollar drafts on everything! I don't believe this is valid during football season but prior to that I was there consistently every week. Oh did I mention free nacho bar on Sundays?!?!   Definitely a place I recommend and go to every chance I get!

n6pR5v0PYtg84ZiSfCmnAQ.text: If you come here, you've got to try the wings!! They're extra crispy without asking for them that way and absolutely yummy. They have a huge menu though we stick to the same things usually pizza wings and beer. Good selection of cold beer on draft.   Very very relaxed atmosphere, older restaurant/bar. Plenty of tvs in the bar.

uZ37oEXucSRnLCTsNnxLSA.text: The food here is amazing!  I've not yet had anything that isn't spectacular.  The new artichoke heart scampi is out of this world!  My husband and I discovered this hidden treasure in our neighborhood 2 years ago in a search for hot wings. The wings are amazing too!  They have some of the best blue cheese dressing ever! The food comes out quickly and the servers are friendly and great.  However, they often forget to bring my wine and my water glass goes empty a lot which is an annoyance for me, hence the reason for only 4 stars. I highly recommend giving it a try. You won't be disappointed!

LWjmFpskQoanEagH6GJ4Jw.text: We order here a couple weeks ago but didn't have time to write a review. But I was highly disappointed first thing is there is a menu online that they said wasn't there menu even though it has your address and your phone number which was highly disappointing cause it has very different pricing that I am pretty sure you have to honor but didn't feel like arguing about it. Then when i went to pick up the order not one of your many servers standing around talking to each other bothered to greet us. Stood in line for 10 minutes before one of your chatty servers decided to walk over and finally help us. Even if they weren't there to help us one of them could have said " I am really sorry about the wait and the take out person is busy gathering another order". I have worked in customer service for 10 plus years. So I would just say the service was just awful. It takes 2 seconds from their socializing to just acknowledge a paying customer. Just overall dissatisfying especially for the price.

5aUcJw7hMcx9DkJ1AaIC9w.text: I'm so shocked by all the 5 star reviews about the food here. This place was lauded to me for weeks by a friend, and I was under the impression it was some sort of pizza institution a kin to Pizza Bianco. Alas, it is not.   So we put in an order for take out; wings and a large pizza for $27. A bit steep, but I was told it was good...  I've had outstanding pizza, I've had the less-than-memorable, standard issue pizza, and I've had truly bad pizza. Pullano's certainly falls into the last category.  Cheese was cheap; entire top of the pizza was covered in a slick of oil, a sure sign of budget ingredients. The sauce had zero flavor. And the crust. Wow. Got the thin crust, and although it wasn't chewy, which is always a plus, that was all it had going for it. Soggy, flacid, flavorless. Seemed under cooked and I was underwhelmed.   I could only stomach one slice, because after that, the roof of my mouth felt like I had just taken a swig of 90 weight gear oil. So greasy.   The wings were passable. Semi-crispy, but swimming in a sauce that was 90% oil and 10% red goo. Real let down here, too.  It's not hard for a bar to turn out a solid pizza, like Santisi Brothers. And I know bars that make exceptional pizzas, like Brown Dog in Telluride. But Pullano's is churning out a product that is better measured against Little Caesars than a real restaurant.   Flock here if you love oil and tasteless carbs. But avoid if you like good pizza, as there's plenty of better choices in town. Papa John's does a better forgettable pizza than Pullano's at a much more reasonable price.

bJZUdX4CyZKTBjYjVr04vA.text: Great variety of wings between sauced & dry rubbed which you don't see often.  The Tomato Garlic Cheese crisp is delicious if you want to stay on the lighter side instead of ordering a pizza but don't get me the pizza is amazing too! Staff is super nice and attentive
